title: Irene
notes: Irene was premiered in the Burgtheater on 21 Jan 1781, and performed only three times before being dropped.

title: Juliane von Lindorak
notes: "Juliane v. Lindorack. / L. in 5 A. n. Gozzi / v. Schöder."

title: Die donnernde Legion
notes: Morrow (249) cites a poster in the Theatermuseum, but does not give the title. Weidmann is named as the librettist on Czech Wikipedia. His name is not on the libretto.

title: Irene
notes: Final performance."Irene. / (Die Einnahme war / Mlle. Jaquet bestimmt."

title: Aline, reine de Golconde
notes: "La Reine Golconde op. / 3. A. et Ballet."

title: Das Landmädchen
notes: "Das Landmädchen L. in / 5. A. a. d. Engl."

title: Concert, Peter Winter and Franz Tausch
notes: "Musikalische Akademie zum Vortheil der Herrn Winter und Tausch. In Churbayer. Diensten."Cf. 26 Mar

title: Wahrheit ist gut Ding
notes: "Wahrheit ist gut Ding / L. in 5. A. / nach dem Lügner d. Gold. / frey bearbeitet v. Schle= / ter."

title: Die Näscherinn
notes: "Die kleine Näscherinn. L. / 1. A. die Horazier. B."Probably = to "Die Näscherinn"?

title: Die junge Indianerinn
notes: Earliest Viennese performance in Hadamowsky on 5 Apr 1769 in the Kärntnertortheater.

title: Erwine von Steinheim
notes: "Ermine [sic] v. Steinheim / Tr. im 5. A. v. Blum= / auer."

title: Concert, Johann Konrad Schlick and Christian Danner
notes: "Musikalische Akademie. zum Vortheil Herrn. Schlick. K. M. aus Gotha und Herrn Tanner aus München."

title: Der Hausvater
notes: Only performance in 1781. First performed in Vienna in 1770.

title: Die Pilgrime von Mekka
notes: Premiere in the Burgtheater on 26 Jul 1780

title: Concert, Anton Ulbrich
notes: "Musikalische Akadamie zum Vortheil Hr. Anton Ulbrich, von WIen.""Anton" may have been either Anton Ignaz Ulbrich (1706–1796) or his son Anton Johann Nepomuk (1754–1830), both trombonists. Neither is known to have composed. One wonders whether this might have been a family concert, perhaps also including Johann Nepomuk Maximilian (1743–1814), who was a composer.

title: Soliman der Zweyte, oder Die drey Sultaninnen
Das Winterquartier in Amerika
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance and that of Der eifersüchtige Liebhaber. It was his first attendance of a public theatrical performances since his return from Trieste."♃. 22. Fevrier. [...] Dela au Spectacle national. D[as] WinterQuartier in America. La Jaquet, jolie actrice. Der eifersüchtige Liebhaber opera comique françois traduit. belle musique. Adamberger chanta bien. La Lang qui est grosse point parfaitement, Vischer bien. L'air de Alonso Sans jalousie point d'amour. J'etois avec M:e de Thun dans la loge du C:te Rosenberg."

title: Concert, Tebaldo Monzani
notes: This was Monzani's only known appearance in Vienna

title: Das Loch in der Thüre
notes: "Hr. Autors Einnahme."This was the third performance, and the proceeds went to Stephanie d. J.Zinendorf attempted to go to this performance, but couldn't find a seat.

title: Concert, Valentin Adamberger
notes: "Musikalische Akademie. / Zum Vortheil Hr. Adambergers Mitglied d. K. K. / N. H. Schaubühne."

title: Concert, Mathias Thurner
notes: "Dergleichen z. V. Hr. Thurners, M. d. Orchest. b. Nationaltheater."Mathias Thurner was a flutist in the orchestra of the court orchestra in Vienna; see Steblin, JAMIS 2008.

title: Concert, French company
notes: "Dergleichen z. V. der Unternehmer des Franz. Schauspiels."

title: Alcide al bivio (TKS)
notes: "Dergleichen z. V. der Tonkünstler Gesellschaft allhier. Alcid am Scheidwege."The planned concerts of the Tonkünstler-Societät before Christmas 1780 had been postponed because of the death of Empress Maria Theresia on 29 Nov 1780. The society's concerts on 11 and 13 Mar 1781 made up for these; the society also held its usual concerts at the end of Lent, on 1 and 3 Apr 1781.

title: Concert, Józef Boruwłaski (dwarf)
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Boruwlaski in Königl. Pohlnischen / Diensten."See Boruwłaski's description of his visit to Vienna in 1781 and his concert in his autobiography, 159ffMorrow (249) notes that the concert is in Zinzendorf, who mentions a guitar player and Adamberger

title: Il natale di Apollo (concert)
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Righini, gen. Apolls Geburtstag."Il natale di Apollo is usually said to have been composed for the concert of the Tonkünstler-Societät in Dec 1789 (see Christoph Henzel, "Righini, Vincenzo," Grove Music Online). This performance in 1781 suggests that the work may have existed in some form at this earlier date.

title: Concert, Friedrich Ramm
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Ramms in Churbayer. Diensten."

title: Concert, Elisabeth Mara
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. der Madame Mara."In Schletter, the date appears as "Dienstag / d. a2. [sic]"MBA, iii:101, Wolfgang to Leopold, 24 Mar:"die Mara ist hier; – sie hat vergangen dienstag eine accademie im Theater gegeben. – ihr Mann hat sich nicht dürfen sehen lassen, sonst hätte das orchstre nicht accompagnirt, weil er in die Zeitungen gedruckt hat, i ganz Wien seye kein Mensch im stande ihm zu accompagniren."

title: Il natale di Apollo (concert)
notes: Reprise of Il natale di Apollo

title: Concert, Peter Winter and Franz Tausch
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Winter und Tausch, in Churbayer. / Diensten."Cf. 2 Feb

title: Concert, Madame Olivieri
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. der Madame Olivieri."Madame Olivieri not yet identified

title: Concert, Madame Varenne
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. der Madam Varennes."In ZinzendorfMadame Varenne played in concerts at the French ambassador's on 24 Mar, 28 Mar, 7 Apr, and 5 May 1781 (on 7 Apr with "Herr Varene", violin), and on 4 Apr at Prince Paar.

title: Die Pilgrime auf Golgotha (TKS)
notes: The oratorio Die Pilgrime auf Golgotha was composed by Johann Georg Albrechtsberger (1736–1809). All four vocal soloists were members of the ensemble of the court theater in Vienna, and all created roles in Mozart's Die Entführung aus dem Serail the following year: Caterina Cavalieri (1755–1801; Konstanze); Therese Teyber (1760–1830; Blonde); Valentin Adamberger (1743?–1804; Belmonte); and Ludwig Fischer (1745–1825; Osmin).

title: Die Pilgrime auf Golgotha (TKS)
notes: Albrechtsberger's Die Pilgrime auf Golgatha was performed.A Mozart symphony was performed and he played the piano.

title: Agnes Bernauerinn
notes: Zinendorf attended this premiere, calling it a "mauvaise tragedie", noting, however, "Schroeder qui fit le rôle du Duc Albert de Bavière, joua comme un ange."

title: Agnes Bernauerinn
notes: This performance was attended by the Emperor, Archduchesses Maria Anna, Maria, and Maria Elisabeth, and Duke Albert von Sachsen-Teschen (WZ, Sat, 21 Apr 1781, no. 32, [6]

title: Die verfolgte Unbekannte
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance, writing "Belle musique."

title: Wissenschaft geht vor Schönheit
notes: This performance in the Burgtheater is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Because it took place on a Friday, it may have been a benefit. Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen" on this day."Wissenschaft. geht vor / Schonheit [sic]. / L. in 3. A. n. G. v. B."

title: Die Gefahren der Verführung
notes: Performed only four times before being dropped.

title: Die Gefahren der Verführung
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance, writing: "Je trouvois Schroeter excellent en vieillard, jeu noble, [debit] agréable."

title: Die verstorbene Ehefrau
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Possibly a benefit.

title: Der flatterhafte Ehemann
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance: "Le soir au Spectacle der flatterhaffte Liebhaber [sic]. Schroeter y joua a merveille en pauvre rôle [...]"

title: Die verstorbene Ehefrau
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschollsen" on this day.

title: Der Schubkarren des Essighändlers
notes: "Der Eßighandler. / L. in 3. A. a. d. Fr."Adapted from Mercier's La Brouette du vinaigrier.Zinzendorf attended these peformances: "Le soir au Theatre. der Wein Eßig Händler. mauvais pièce que Schroeter rendit tres suportable par son jeu excellent. Ariadne zu Naxos Ein melodrama. M:e Schroeter tres bien [****], joua assez bien. L'orage a merveille."

title: Der Zaubergürtel
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen."

title: Die Brüder
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps a Friday benefit. Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen" on this day.

title: Hamlet
notes: Probably with Schröder in the title role?

title: Hanns bleibt Hanns, oder der Bauer, ein Fürst
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps a Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen"  on this day.

title: Eugenie, oder Die Tugend in Gefahr
Der Liebhaber als ein Schriftsteller und Bedienter
Adelaide, oder die Antipathie gegen die Liebe
Theaters closed (anniversary of death of Francis Stephen)
Adelheit von Veltheim
notes: This work and performance is not in Hadamowsky.

title: Theaters closed for Mariä Geburt (Nativity of Mary)
Die Schwiegermutter
notes: This performance, on a Friday, is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna/

title: Reinhold und Armida
notes: Possibly a benefit for composer Peter Winter, who seems still to have been in Vienna?

title: Der Ostindienfahrer
notes: Performed just three times in 1781, and revived for two performances in 1785.

title: L'Olympiade, ou le Triomphe de l'amitié
Iphigenie auf Tauris
notes: Entry to the theater was free in celebration of the news of Marie Antoinette's successful delivery of a male child and potential heir to the French throne, Louis-Joseph de France, on 22 Oct 1781. (Louis-Joseph died on 4 Jun 1789.)

title: Der Furchtsame
notes: Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater closed on this day. The earliest performance of Der Furchtsame in Hadamowsky was on 1 Sep 1764, and the latest on 19 Jan 1779.

title: Robert und Kalliste
notes: First performed by the court theater in Vienna on 1 Oct 1778.

title: Philotas
notes: Perhaps given by the Theaterschule? No Viennese playbook in the ÖNB.

title: Präsentirt das Gewehr
notes: Not specified as being done by the Kindertheater, but Präsentirt das Gewehr was in their repertoire.

title: Der Weise in der That
notes: Hadamowsky has a performance of Der Weise in der That as early as 14 May 1768, and it had been in the repertory of the Nationaltheater since 2 Jul 1776.

title: Die Haushaltung nach der Mode
notes: This Friday performance is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Theaterschule?

title: Theaters closed (anniversary of Maria Theresia's death)
Theaters closed (anniversary of Maria Theresia's death)
Reinhold und Armida
notes: This Friday performances is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Theaterschule?

title: Der kleine Grenadier
notes: This Friday performance is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps Theaterschule?

title: Das Loch in der Thüre
notes: This divertissement is not In Hadamowsky.

title: Adelheit von Veltheim
notes: This Friday performance is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Theaterscule?

title: Der Furchtsame
notes: This Friday performance is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps Theaterschule.

title: Santa Elena al Calvario (TKS)
notes: Schletter: "Musikalisce Akademie. z. V. Der errichteten Tonkünstlergesellschaft, im Kärnt. Th. Theater, genannt: Helena am Calvarienberge, von Haße."The oratorio was Hasse's Santa Elena al Calverio.

title: Der Geburtstag
notes: This Friday performance is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps Theaterschule?

title: Der Geburtstag
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Theaterschule?

title: Stirbt der Fuchs, so gilt sein Balg
notes: This Friday performance is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obyna. Theaterschule?

notes: This Friday performance is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Theaterschule.
